de.tub.ise.ec.clients

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tub.ise.ec.clients.Client
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ICrud

    public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
implements ICrud
    Implementation of a CRUD client Client can write only to MasterServer but read from Master and SlaveServer. (Master server extends slave server)
    Author:
    Jacek Janczura

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Client()
      Default constructor with hardcoded test values.

      Constructor can take two parameters to start master sender.
      Client(int portSlave, java.lang.String hostSlave, int portMaster, java.lang.String hostMaster)
      Constructor creates the client.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client()
        Default constructor with hardcoded test values.

      • Client

        public Client(int port,
              java.lang.String host)
        Constructor can take two parameters to start master sender. Slave server can either work on localhost or not exists.
        Parameters:
        port - Master server port
        host - Master server host

      • Client

        public Client(int portSlave,
              java.lang.String hostSlave,
              int portMaster,
              java.lang.String hostMaster)
        Constructor creates the client. It can take four parameters to parametrise both master and slave sender.
        Parameters:
        portSlave - Slave server port
        hostSlave - Slave server host
        portMaster - Master server port
        hostMaster - Master server host

    • Method Detail

      • crazyUpdateAsynchronic

        public void crazyUpdateAsynchronic()
        Method used for benchmarking latency and staleness of asynchronic replication. This method sends an update (In our KV store write is equal to an update) every second for 100s using asynchron. replication.

      • crazyUpdateSynchronic

        public void crazyUpdateSynchronic()
        Method used for benchmarking latency and staleness of synchronic replication. This method sends an update (In our KV store write is equal to an update) every second for 100s using synchron. replication.

      • generateId

        public java.lang.String generateId(java.lang.String key)
        Methode used to generate unique transaction ID. UUID.randomUUID() is used which is the correct approach in java to generate unique ID.
        Parameters:
        key - key from the KV store to generate ID for
        Returns:
        unique transaction ID generated for the key from KV store

      • listKeys

        public de.tub.ise.hermes.Request listKeys()
        Method builds the request to list all the keys in a keystore.
        Returns:
        ready request to send to the server
